reviews.headline: Great makeup remover!
reviews.comments: This product is the best at gently but thoroughly removing all makeup. I use this first, and then follow with a regular face wash. My skin has never been better—it is so soft and free of blemishes. And the oil smells so good, it feels like a decadent treat every night!

reviews.headline: Decent cleanser, great makeup remover
reviews.comments: It's an ok cleanser, there's nothing really special about it. The smell is advertised as lavender, but it's closer to tea tree. However, it's an absolutely amazing makeup remover. It's very gentle and no scrubbing needed. My makeup basically melted away.

reviews.headline: My forever cleansing oil!
reviews.comments:
I love this cleansing oil so much. My skin feels sooo soft after using it. And the smell alone is enough to make me want to wash my face every night. 
It is a little pricey, but when I tried getting a cheaper oil, I was so sad that I had to go buy this again anyway. So save yourself money and buy this one the first time!

reviews.headline: Absolutely love!
reviews.comments: This leaves my skin feeling so clean and soft! Doesn't break out my acne prone skin either!

reviews.headline: Holy grail for cleaning pores
reviews.comments: This cleansing oil is amazing for removing skin "grit." Leave it on for 15 minutes or so & gently massage every 5 minutes. It loosens gunk in congested pores like nothing I've ever tried before & without drying out your skin, or ruining your skin barrier. I do also use AHA & BHA acids as a part of my skin routine. Game changer.

reviews.headline: Just okay
reviews.comments: Expected more from this because of the name brand and price but it was average compared to all the other cleaning oils i used in the past. I wouldn't buy it again.

reviews.headline: Pore clogging ingredients
reviews.comments: Although this product is advertised as non comedogenic it has multiple potential pore clogging ingredients. I would not reccomend for acne prone skin.

reviews.headline: Worth it
reviews.comments: I've purchased this twice but recently tried to switch to a more inexpensive oil cleanser since my skin was "doing well". Two weeks without this product and I had dry patches and breakouts. I guess this was my secret holy grail the whole time. I'm never using another oil cleanser again- this one is THAT GIRL.

reviews.headline: My favorite first cleanse
reviews.comments: I've tried a number of cleansing oils and balms, and this is my favorite. It removes makeup very well, and rinses off easily without leaving a ton of greasy residue for my cleanser to handle.

reviews.headline: Fantastic product
reviews.comments: I stumbled on this product when a salesperson used it to cleanse my hand where I had sampled a lip stain. It worked amazingly well, and I fell in love with the scent.  This is now the only product I use to remove my eye makeup. The oil itself is smooth, and the scent is light. It does not burn the eyes. I also don't have to scrub; the makeup is easily removed with just gentle massaging of the oil into my skin. Rinses clean and doesn't leave my skin feeling raw or dry.

reviews.headline: It's a great makeup remover
reviews.comments: It works perfectly at getting off makeup, especially mascara. Four stars because, for an oil, it did dry my skin out a bit. I'll continue to use it to see if continued use will change that or not.

reviews.headline: Splurge!
reviews.comments: I really love this Cleansing Oil! It's most definitely a splurge item for me because it's a bit pricey, but very nice to use. The smell is relaxing and the oils in this do not irritate my sensitive skin whatsoever. What surprised me the most was that it really is a deep cleansing oil. After applying a salicylic acid lotion to my skin before the gym, I used this to remove it afterwards and I was shook at how many blackheads, and CC's this oil pulled out. I honestly thought my skin WAS pretty unclogged! I massaged it into my dry skin for about 2-3 minutes before I could feel all the grit being released. Kept massaging for about 10 total for a good cleansing. I have skin that gets congested easily, and oil cleansing helps so much. I absolutely recommend this to anyone looking for an oil cleanser. It is a thin oil so I like to use 5 pumps to ensure I'm using enough to saturate my skin. I choose not to use it as a makeup remover because it is so expensive and I feel like I need to use a lot to break down the makeup. That could just be me. As a double cleanse or deep oil cleanse… this is really great! Soft skin. No irritation.

reviews.headline: Best cleansing oil
reviews.comments: I use this Kiehl cleansing oil for my evening routine. It does the best job of removing make up and daily oil/pollutants. After working 3 pumps into skin, I rinse it off with warm water. Then I use a Cerave cleanser.

reviews.headline: my fave 1st cleanse product!!
reviews.comments: i have tried so many oils/balms for my 1st cleanse. THIS is very good. no rubbing required at all really just melts all that sunscreen and makeup off. i love the pump as well.

reviews.headline: Fabulous pre cleanser
reviews.comments: I bought this to remove make up before using my daily cleanser. I needed something super gentle but would remove makeup, especially mascara. This does a great job doing that without scrubbing. Would also be a great daily cleanser if you're looking for a non drying cleanser. I just needed a little something extra.

reviews.headline: No no no
reviews.comments: After two uses, my under eye area feels like it's been burned and I've had to treat the area with soothing aloe for days now.  And my eyes appear swollen and red from the irritation.  This is definitely not for sensitive skin or sensitive eyes.

reviews.headline: Lovely makeup remover/cleanser
reviews.comments: I love this stuff! This was my first time using oil as a makeup remover after using micellar water for years…and I love how easily it removes everything! Plus it doesn't make me break out!

reviews.headline: Allergic?
reviews.comments: I received a sample of the product and decided to try it out since I'm looking for a oil cleanser to replace my Lush cleanser. Initial thoughts were that the smell was strong and it was very thin but I still used it. At first I loved how soft my skin felt but then I noticed my face became really red and hot and my nose was itching like crazy. My face is pretty used to fragranced products but something in this caused a reaction.

reviews.headline: Fragrance
reviews.comments: It does what it's supposed to do use it as my first cleanse to take off my makeup / any dirt from the day. I also haven't had any breakouts or anything from using this cleanser. The only downside is the fragrance it is too strong. For the price there are better cleansers and makeup balms than this.

reviews.headline: it's a no for me
reviews.comments: wow the fragrance is like nothing I've ever experienced in a skin product before. extremely overwhelming and once I sucked it in, it was hard to breathe for a minute after. I could not get this off my face quick enough. also it burned my eyes.

faceoff_positive.comments: What an absolutely fantastic product! I got it in a great little sample pack of all Keihl's products. I was apprehensive to use it, as I have never used an oil as a face wash before. However, after recently starting to use retinol, my skin has been dry and peeling, and I was willing to use anything that could help provide some relief. I was very pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this smelled, how gentle it was on my skin, and how un-oily it was! It even took off my eye makeup and did not cause any pain in my eyes whatsoever. It was extremely gentle, and was very similar to the Dermalogica pre-wash face wash, which essentially dissolves your makeup. I still used a foaming cleanser afterwards, but this was such an excellent product to gently get everything off my face, and I think you would be fine using it alone as a face wash or makeup remover.
faceoff_positive.headline: Fabulously unexpected!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I don't understand how so many people think this product is great. I've been using it since June and haven't been able to get over the weird, rancid-like smell it has. I can smell the "botanical" aspect, but there's also something really funny about it, and it's not good. 

This product will remove face makeup fine, but it will not remove my eye makeup (tested with Benefit Rollerlash, which is difficult to remove — so I had low expectations, but also it couldn't remove my Smashbox Full Exposure and cannot remove Fenty eye primer). When putting it all over the eyes as needed to remove makeup, it will seek into the eyes because it's so thin, and it will sting. When I use it before bed, I wake up with very irritated, uncomfortable eyes. 

Additionally, the product is very, very thin, making it slightly more difficult to apply than other cleansing oils or mills as it runs down your hands so quickly. I think this is partly why it gets in the eyes. It washes away nicely enough, doesn't get milky at all (if you don't like that) or leave any residue. Once my face dries, I have to immediately scurry to my moisturizer because my face is immediately so tight and dry.

Lastly, I got the full-size bottle, and although it has a twist cap for on/off, it WILL leak in your luggage. I have also tried putting it into other containers for travel, but you must make sure that they're a good liquid container. I've had it seep out of other containers with screw lids; the thin slippery formula can just go through them! 

I'm going back to Boscia MakeUp-BreakUp Cool Cleansing Oil. I so wish I had not purchased the full size of this Kieh's product. What a waste! :(
faceoff_negative.headline: Don't understand the rave reviews
